dummyPoly1.Wiki: Specify the Damipoli ID that is the center of the bottom of the range. If there is no Damipoly or -1 is entered, the center coordinates will be the reference.

dummyPoly2.Wiki: Used only when the range type is a capsule. Additional Damipoly (capsule) that creates a line segment with two Damipoly

baseHeightOffset.Wiki: How much to raise or lower the Y coordinate of the bottom (cylinder / prism)

invalidFlag.Wiki: If this flag is ON, the action button will not appear and no judgment will be made.

grayoutFlag.Wiki: If this flag is ON, the action button will be grayed out and no judgment will be made.

priority.Wiki: Priority when multiple action buttons overlap (0 to 99, closer to 0 has priority)

execInvalidTime.Wiki: Invalid time after execution (-infinite by value)

actionGroupId.Wiki: ID for enabling by group from act. While hanging, you can get items, but you can't open doors.

sameCategoryActionDisplay.Wiki: Whether action buttons with the same category specified from the program are displayed overlapping each other.

gameKey.Wiki: Action button and corresponding game key. Also linked to icon display.

pointRadius.Wiki: Radius (point display range is fixed to cylinder)

pointHeight.Wiki: Height (point display range is fixed to cylinder). -1 refers to the numerical value of the action executable range.

pointBaseHeightOffset.Wiki: See how much to raise or lower the Y coordinate of the bottom surface.

textRadius.Wiki: Radius (button icon display range is fixed to cylinder). -1 refers to the numerical value of the action executable range.

textHeight.Wiki: Height (button icon display range is fixed to cylinder). -1 refers to the numerical value of the action executable range.

textBaseHeightOffset.Wiki: How much to raise or lower the Y coordinate of the bottom surface.

iconOffsetX.Wiki: Value to offset in the Y-axis direction from the dummy poly position specified by dummy poly 1

iconOffsetZ.Wiki: Value to offset in the Z-axis direction from the dummy poly position specified in dummy poly 1

doneFlag.Wiki: Event flag ID for flag management of whether it has been executed (-1: No management event flag)
